newsitem.title: USA: US Midwest direct hogs seen steady-off $1.00-trade.
newsitem.headline: US Midwest direct hogs seen steady-off $1.00-trade.

text.p: U.S. Midwest direct cash hog prices Thursday were seen steady to $1.00 per cwt lower, pressured by outlooks for large marketings following the New Years holiday on Wednesday, livestock dealers said.
Losses also were expected as packers bid lower to fend off weaker operating margins amid steep declines in pork cut-out values on Tuesday, they said.
Pork cut-out values were quoted down $0.92 to $1.19 per cwt, according to USDA. Declines in loins of $5.00 and butts of $6.00 overwhelmed $2.50 gains in pork bellies.
Top prices for hogs delivered to the plant in Iowa and southern Minnesota could range $54.50 to $55.00.
Illinois hog buyers said top prices at the plant could range $54.00 to $54.50. Indiana/Ohio top plant hog prices could range $54.00 to $54.50.
Losses Thursday also were seen amid ideas that many packers were well supplied with live hog inventories and would not be aggressively chasing hogs, the livestock dealers said.
